title: Equistone could call the shots in XLN telecoms sale
text:
Buyout firm Equistone has emerged as a contender to buy a controlling stake in XLN, a Blackstone-backed telecoms outfit.

The private equity group, which is the former investment arm of Barclays, is one of a handful of potential buyers in an auction for the London-based company, City sources said.

Equistone has invested in companies such as restaurant group Gaucho, luxury shoe retailer Kurt Geiger, tour operator Audley Travel and flower delivery service Interflora.

XLN is understood to be working with bankers at Lazard on the sale process. While the company could be valued between £150m and £200m, a deal is not guaranteed. Reports earlier in the year put the value at £250m.
